How hast thou helped <FI>him that is<Fi> without power? <FI>how<Fi> savest thou the arm <FI>that hath<Fi> no strength?
How hast thou counselled <FI>him that hath<Fi> no wisdom? and <FI>how<Fi> hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?<CM>
Dead <FI>things<Fi> are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.<RF>and the…: or, with the inhabitants<Rf>
Hell <FI>is<Fi> naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, <FI>and<Fi> hangeth the earth upon nothing.
He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
He holdeth back the face of his throne, <FI>and<Fi> spreadeth his cloud upon it.
He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.<RF>until…: Heb. until the end of light with darkness<Rf>
The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.<RF>the proud: Heb. pride<Rf>
By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
Lo, these <FI>are<Fi> parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?<CM>
